<JD_START>
Job Title: Associate Project Manager

Location: California, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Product Management, Project Management

Description:
Title: Associate Project Manager

Location: Anaheim, CA

Work type: Hybrid work

Job type: Full-time

Full Job Description

Client is hiring an Associate Project Manager at its Anaheim, California headquarters.Come join a nimble, multinational cleantech company working on the latest water treatment technologies and delivering turn-key projects.Take pride in providing clean water and innovative solutions to cities & industries and turning waste into valuable resources.

Requirements

Associate Project Management:

Work alongside the Project Managers, managing design progress, procurement, and subcontractor and vendor management.Project cost negotiation with suppliers to achieve optimal pricing.Development of scopes of work and procuring Request for Quote (RFQ) packagesLogistic planning allowing contractors to complete work in timely and efficient mannerDeliver quality projects within the given time frame and budgetInteract with clients in a professional mannerWork with Engineering, Designers, Construction Manager, Admin Team on project related basisTrack/Negotiate change ordersSubmit RFI's and submittalsWrite accurate schedulesCreate, organize, and distribute bid documentsCoordinate and collect subcontractor and vendor bids to assist Project Managers in preparing accurate and timely cost estimatesEvaluate bids for materials, equipment, and supplies, and select vendors for goods and servicesGenerate purchase orders to vendors and track purchase orderCoordinate equipment and material deliveries for Project Managers and othersThe work may take place in a combination of office settings and construction sites. The Associate Project Manager must be willing to travel to various project sites and work outdoors in various weather conditions, as necessary.

Experience And Skills Required

Education or formal training in project management, engineering, business administration is preferred; or relevant work experience may be substituted1+ years of experience in a construction, engineering, or architectural setting is preferred.Proficient in Abode PDF and Microsoft Office 365, including Excel, Word, and Outlook

Attention to Detail: Ability to perform tasks with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills and the ability to propose solutions to problems.

Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to communicate across various levels of an organization.

Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changes and work in a fast-paced environment.

Experience in Procore, Timberline, and Microsoft Project is preferred but not requiredWorking knowledge of construction industry standards is preferred, but not required.Financial management experience creating and managing complex budgetsResults-orientated with proven ability to organize, plan and prioritize work to meet deadlinesHigh level of motivation, integrity, and commitment to team and customersStrong work ethic with an unwavering commitment to quality and professional work

Skills Associated

CommunicationAnalytical SkillsAttention to DetailBid ProcessesEasily AdaptableInterpersonal CommunicationOffice 365Purchase OrdersRequest for Information (RFI)Scopes Of Work

Benefits

Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)Training & DevelopmentHybrid work depending on task and availabilityStock Option Plan

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
